content.description: You can tell that it’s a climb, by the way that it is.
content.location: Left of the steep alcove known as Dead Flowers.

content.description: Nice compression boulder problem on some tufa material down low, that feels a little sporty to a jug, then some pumpy 12- on flat holds to the chains.
content.location: First route on the left of the "second tier" routes with green Camp steel draws. Climbs the nice orange/tan flow-ish stone then up dark face skirting the two mini roofs up high.

content.description: Crux up high with some committing moves below.
content.location: Climb easy slab for a couple moves and then lean back into the wave.

content.description: Extension of Hourglass. Rides the wave looking feature. So you could imagine where the crux is.
content.location: Extension of third route to the right.

content.description: Starts on ramp and battles the short steepness like it’s neighbors, but crux is on the technical bit. Sharp stone.
content.location: Almost right side of ramp. Goes up the rusty streak

content.description: Long balancy, tilted moves off the deck. Are you climbing a trough or a leaning boulder? Hard to tell until you gain the vertical easier section. There are two leveled spots in the scree, the higher one can be used to eliminate the low boulder, for an easier experience.
content.location: Furthest route to the right, before the the trail levels out. Starts above the “belay pit”.

content.description: A great layback crack sequence starts this one. Pretty sustained afterwards for several bolts. Hard to read. Don't stick clip the second bolt for better rope and fall management.
content.protection: Bolts. It's recommended to not stick clip second bolt
content.location: At the third tier, in the sunken belay area with gravel, the obvious crack boulder stares right at ya. Go left after a couple bolts.

content.description: Lower 3-bolt V6+, to a good rest, then a 3-bolt V6+, and two bolts of 5.11 moves to chains.
content.location: At the second tier of the base of cliff, is an obvious blue-gray streak with chain draws. Tufa Petita is to the left and finishes on same chains. Labor Fruits is to the right.

content.description: Sustained bouldery tech, off the deck, for 6 bolts, leads to fun crux, then changes character.  Delicate upper moves to chains.
content.location: Up trail from first cluster of routes, to second "tier". Right of wide blue streak.

content.description: Starts on ramp for a couple bolts, then kicks back in angle a bit. Enters the “hard to read” style, that is indicative of this cliff. Cool holds, such as the famous hourglass shaped, vertical slot.
content.location: Third line to the right. Starts by the flare crack on the ramp.

content.description: 6 bolts of V6 type movement with a couple easier moves to the chains, on perfect stone.
content.location: On the third tier of the base of cliff, this will be the leftmost route, before the platform disappears.

content.description: 4 bolt boulder problem, with a lower bolt to keep the rope out of feet. Sustained resistance to the chains.
content.location: In the middle of the platform at third tier. Left of the obvious dihedral that starts “Offered Chains” and right of Fern’s

content.description: Three separate boulder problems of differing styles, with an bad shake at about 3/4 height. Easier climbing passing final bolt. Need consensus on this one, someone come climb it and downgrade please.
content.location: In the cluster of the "second tier" routes with green Camp steel draws. Climbs the grey and tan streaks just right of 'Labor Fruits'.

content.description: Scramble up the alcove, on a shelf clip a couple bolts before engaging in a steep, left leaning feature. You may stem the left cave thing to gain the first few holds if needed. Crux is not very high up, then fun mysterious moves for several bolts.
content.location: First line on left side. Climbs right side of obvious alcove

content.description: A rest can be had after Dancing in the Dirt. Then a sustained, 4 bolt “bouldery” crux off the shelf to the chains.  Some cool pockets lead to compression finishing touch. Great movement.
content.location: Extension straight up from Dancing in the Dirt.

content.description: Climbs the bouldery leaning shelves, with a long committing move to help you gain the vertical climbing. Great stone after the shelf for several bolts. Fun climbing
content.location: Forth line to right. Starts middle of ramp

content.description: Shares same sweet boulder on bottom of Offered, and breaks right into thin, balancy, weirdness. Steeper than it looks. As sharp as it looks. Don't stick clip second bolt. If you fall going to the second bolt, the belayer can easily protect your fall. If you have both pre-clipped, its steep enough that you could swing back and make contact with the hill behind.
content.location: Starts on the layback crack feature in the sunken belay, at third tier, and moves right.
Second route from the left. Starts just right of alcove
